message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Doxorubicin is known to have a maximum lifetime dose due to the risk of cardiac toxicity. Option A is incorrect because doxorubicin does not frequently cause an acneiform rash. Option B is incorrect as doxorubicin does not increase the risk of DVT and PE. Option D is incorrect as doxorubicin does not have a maximum lifetime dose due to the risk of pulmonary toxicity.

D is incorrect because doxorubicin does not cause pulmonary toxicity.

Options A and B are incorrect as doxorubicin does not cause an acneiform rash or increase the risk of DVT and PE. Option D is also incorrect as doxorubicin is not known to cause pulmonary toxicity.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Doxorubicin can cause a wide range of side effects, including bone marrow suppression, hair loss, and gastrointestinal symptoms, but the most serious and dose-limiting toxicity is cardiac toxicity. This is why it has a maximum lifetime dose. None of the other options are true.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only option (C) is correct. Doxorubicin has a cumulative lifetime dose limit because of the risk of cardiac toxicity. It does not commonly cause an acneiform rash (option A), nor does it significantly increase the risk for DVT and PE (option B). It does not have a significant risk for pulmonary toxicity (option D). The irregular pulse and holosystolic murmur may be indicative of underlying cardiac issues, further emphasizing the need to monitor for cardiotoxicity.
